DOC.brief_summary: Background The purpose present control clinical trial ass effect single 60 min application transcutaneous electrical nervous stimulation ( TENS ) sensory stimulation threshold ( STS ) , compare application motor stimulation threshold ( MTS ) well untreatment , surface electromyographic ( sEMG ) kinesiographic activity patient temporomandibular disorder ( TMD ) . Methods Sixty female subject , select accord inclusion/exclusion criterion , suffer unilateral TMD remission assign MTS , STS untreatment . Pre- post-treatment difference sEMG activity temporalis anterior ( TA ) , masseter ( MM ) , digastric ( DA ) sternocleidomastoid muscle ( SCM ) , well interocclusal distance ( ID ) , within group test use Wilcoxon test , difference among group assess Kruskal-Wallis test ; level significance set p â‰¤ 0.01 .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between Sensory Motor Transcutaneous Electrical Nervous Stimulation Electromyographic Kinesiographic Activity Patients With Temporomandibular Disorder : Controlled Clinical Trial
DOC.criteria: age le 30 year ; female gender righthanded ( 710 point Edinburgh inventory ) ; presence complete permanent dentition , exception third molar ; normal occlusion ; diagnosis unilateral arthrogenous TMD Research Diagnostic Criteria TMD ( RDC/TMD ) , Axis I , group II III pacemaker electrical device previous experience TENS biofeedback systemic disease history local general trauma neurological psychiatric disorder muscular disease cervical pain bruxism diagnose presence parafunctional facet and/or anamnesis parafunctional tooth clench and/or grind pregnancy assumption antiinflammatory , analgesic , antidepressant myorelaxant drug fix removable prosthesis fix restoration affect occlusal surface previous concurrent orthodontic orthognathic treatment
